description:
The Job Leading indie studio hiring Assistant to support our EVP, Film Development. Extremely busy and high-profile desk. Seeking a self-starter who is articulate, organized, a voracious reader, and a constant consumer of film/TV. This is for someone interested in Creative and Business, working with talent, and pursuing Development in a growing company producing studio tentpoles and franchises. Must have EA experience at a major studio, agency, production, or management company.
Responsibilities
  • Administrative tasks including, but not limited to rolling calls, answering and fielding heavy phone calls in a professional manner; handling, processing, and filing all incoming emails; scheduling meetings and calls while managing the executive’s calendar; securing reservations and event tickets; coordinating project travel and itineraries; maintaining contact lists; tracking and submitting expenses, et al.
  • Greet and interact with talent, clients, and visitors with a positive and helpful attitude.
  • Interface with high-profile talent, studio executives, and agents/managers to support executive and the department with completion of ongoing projects.
  • Handle information requests from the public, media and high-level industry players.
  • Perform other clerical duties such as data entry, transcribing, and compiling spreadsheets.
  • Liaise with other relevant departments to complete assignments and ensure required tasks are completed efficiently for projects to progress.
  • Assist in handling requests made by crewmembers, directors, department heads, and production management/supervisors beginning with various stages of development, continuing through production and the release of each film.
  • Handle high-level confidential information discreetly and professionally.

Requirements
  • Must have at least 1-2 years of Assistant experience at a major studio, agency, production company, or management company.
  • Knowledge of the entertainment industry including talent and key players.
  • Looking for someone who is a self-starter with sharp attention to detail and the ability to prioritize with minimal direction and multiple projects in motion at a time.
  • Must be able to quickly acclimate to a fast-paced environment and be able to anticipate needs; following through on all tasks through completion.
  • Candidates must be able to assume the role with ease and not need to be trained in the basics of being an assistant.
  • Willingness to work as needed and complete all tasks and responsibilities with a positive attitude.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to be resourceful and proactive when issues arise, excellent organizational skills, strong multi-tasking, and time-management skills.
  • Tech savvy and able to assist heavily with media management and organization.
  • Previous production and/or development experience is not required but is preferred and a plus.
